body: A note: I can extract using zip4j but not with linux and windows applications. If I zip with windows or linux applications, it works normally.
this could depend on the app you're using to extract, since with such big size `zip4j` should automatically use [ZIP64](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_(file_format)#ZIP64) in place of standard ZIP
I have used 7zip or 7z and not used unzip
Do you have any recommendations for a program so I can do some more testing? Sorry for English'
AFAIK [7-zip supports ZIP64](https://sevenzip.osdn.jp/chm/general/formats.htm) so I don't see a reason why it shouldn't work.. @srikanth-lingala any hint on this?

No doubt that Zip64 is working in your use case. Considering the size of the zip file, asking you to provide the zip file is a bad idea.

Please allow me to make it clear: 
You are trying to zip 12 GB files into a zip file using zip4j. You can only extract the zip file generated by zip4j when using zip4j, not 7zip/unzip. When you zip these file using other libraries like 7zip, it could be extracted by zip4j and 7zip. Am I right?

@heberpimentel @nicolabeghin I will try to reproduce this and update the thread. We have tests here for Zip64 format, but the zip file is created and extracted by zip4j, and if I understand correctly, the issue comes when the huge zip file is created with other tools.
@srikanth-lingala it's the opposite ... I'm generating with zip4j, and trying to extract with other programs

issue.title: Corrupted archive with large files

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body:
As the title says, i'm experiencing trouble when trying to zip large files (over 10 GB) with compression method 'STORE'.

The process seems to work fine, no exception occurs, but the zip created cannot be exctracted using anything else than zip4j library. For exemple when trying to extract the zip with winrar, i get the error : 'Checksum error... the file is corrupt'

I have tried changing some of the ZipParameters, unsuccessfully.
The library works fine with smaller archives.
I am running on windows (7 and 10) 64 bits

I am going to turn to another library in the meantime, but a fix would be welcome, since zip4j is one of the fastest, and simple to use (nice job !)
